CatDescriptText: Part of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 22, 1950, pg. 7, reads: "Heart Attack Cause of Death of Leon Clark, Popular Sportsman Stricken as Week-End Party Neared Close. Funeral services were held for Leon (Pigmeat) Clark at St. Luke Baptist Church Wednesday morning at eleven o'clock with the Rev. B. L. Mason officiating. The body was shipped to Youngstown for final rites and burial on Thursday.  Mr. Clark's death came suddenly and without warning, Monday morning as one o'clock while he was attending a weekend party at the home of his late friend Walter (Squirrel) Woods on Webster Avenue....Survivors include a widow, Mrs. Dolores Clark, three children, William, Leon Jr. and Carla Clark; his mother, Mrs. Ella Clark, sister, Mrs. Mary Borges, and brother Theodore Clark..."
TitMainTitle: Funeral procession for Leon "Pigmeat" Clark, with women holding floral arrangement, including Ruby Wheeler Woods front right, on Webster Avenue, Hill District
